result.execSummary:
The defendant Linda L Cobbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court will consider terminating probation early if all conditions are completed.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS AS TO ALL COUNTS:
Complete a parenting class. Successfully complete Anger Management counseling. Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim or any child. Do not use any objects to discipline a child.

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

timeConds.notes: AS TO ALL CTS: This time is stayed pending a review on 6-27-14.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Linda L Cobbs in court.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 AND 3 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
*
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: S. T. and Glen W.    
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 6/27/14.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim or any child.
-Do not use any objects to discipline a child.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Court will consider terminating probation early if all conditions are completed.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Linda L Cobbs in court with attorney Gary R George.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to COUNT 1: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor, COUNT 2: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor and COUNT 3: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
STIPULATION FOR SUBSTITUTION OF COUNSEL, FILED BY ATTORNEY GARY R. GEORGE.

Defendant Linda L Cobbs in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Oral No Contact Order with S.T. (7/31/2000).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Linda L Cobbs in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Linda L Cobbs in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
